content: Quick, simple, clear. Don't need to get repetitive strain injury by typing into my phone.
This is the best app about and I've tried most of them.
Easy to use- great explanations of key words
very useful app but in the last version the main buttons to navigate the app are missing making the navigation more difficult for me.
replyContent: I replaced the buttons because there was not enough place to put all the buttons and because now you can swipe right and left to go to the last/next sentence. Is there a problem in the app and you cannot swipe?

content: I think this is an excellent app, especially for beginners
So much better than Babbel for beginners!
Using for some weeks, too much helpful, for a1-a2 must have.
Excellent application for learning Spanish. Well presented, engaging and quite addictive! Highly recommended üòä

Very good, best l, ve tried. Since the last update 11_1 the clock is,nt Functioning.17-8-2020, The clock is still not working. Clock OK now. 20-8-2020. As usual any small hiccups cleared up, always being improved.
Unarguably the best and the fastest Spanish learning app without any hidden fees or monthly subscriptions. Pay once and keep it forever. Keep up the good work!

This app is amazing. It has an engaging way of not only teaching you Spanish words, but also how to use them. It has a way of making you WANT to keep studying. My son is 12 and had NEVER studied any other languages yet he's quickly learning. Not just learning phrases. You're going to learn how to actually speak and understand spanish. And worth paying the very small fee for the full app. Other apps never made me feel they were actually worth it. Excellent app.
Not easily beaten, so many ways to use it. Try the free version and for a few dollars the extended app is a bargain. You are the limit, not the app(s).
List of exercises is not showing up in the paid version
replyContent:
Hello,
The list of exercises in the full version is very long (over 6000) and leads to crashes on some phones, that is why I took it out of the full app.

content: Easy and effective
Best app! I am not forgetting anything that I've learnt from this app. Kudos. Been using free version for a few days already and i couldn't wait to buy the full. So here i am.
Great value for money when paid in Indian rupees
I love this app! Makes learning easy!
Exceptional!
again, best language app ever!!
Perfect learning tool.
It gives very clear explanations and introduces new words and concepts little by little. The pro version contains over 6,000 sentences for less than $3!!
Very fluid and enjoyable to use
It's the best app. Fantastic! Five Stars!

I like this app for where I am skillwise, largely beginner. I like how the sentence structure is emphasized with incremental examples that add new vocabulary as you progress. Wishlist - I dont appreciate the assessment of my progress on the opening page. No goals were ever set, it is self-paced. If I wanted a "grade" every day, I'd pay for a tutor. Also, it would be helpful if the exams were cumulative.
replyContent: Hello. I'm sorry you feel like that, the 'assessment' is meant to be humorous. On the other hand, it is meant to give you a rough indication of how much time you should spend with the app. What I am interested more in, though, is what you mean by the exams being cumulative.

content: I'm a native English speaker who has no idea how to explain English verb conjugation using terms like preterite, participle, indicative, etc. So I failed to comprehend foreign language grammar explanations using the same verbiage. This app is invaluable for my (subjective) miraculous comprehension and retention of Spanish grammar rules without rote memorization of word charts. The key to success is daily self tests before moving forward with new material! Thank you so very much for this app.
very good!
replyContent: Hello, did you leave one star by mistake?

content: Very useful

Straight forward, no bloat, no cutesy games. Perfect! Excellent for grammar, which (contrary to popular belief) is a vital part of learning any language. Fast, no nonsense language acquisition. Well done!

So far - excellent. I've looked at many many "learn Spanish" apps including duolingo and others. They are either not very good (at least for me) and in some cases too expensive for an old "pensionista". So far I'm very very pleased with this. I'm English & have lived in Spain for 8 years. I've painfully acquired a few words but this is the first time I feel I'm making real progress. I'll rate it again in a couple of weeks. Thank you.
Very happy and satisfied
This app is amazing. Giving 4 Stars because I want you to release this app for Italian and Portuguese as well!
replyContent: There is no company developing these apps, there is only one person, me. I do the programming and also the language work. This takes a lot of effort and time. It took me around 2 years to develop these apps to this level, and I am still improving them. When I have time, I will make an app for Italian, as I don't know Portuguese.

content: Very helpful. I haven't even finished one tenth of the content, but it is organized well.
One of the best Spanish learning apps I have used and believe me I have tried many. Thanks
Best app I've found for lazy learning. If I actually applied myself, I'd be conversant in Spanish quickly
Simple but very nice way to learn Spanish!
super learning system

content: The best I ve tried. Teaches common phrases, which are likely to use, gradually adding more words and slowly adding difficulty.! If I was to make the app, I ve done the same)
Very good app good in-dept explanation of grammar without being dull Recommended
Good app for study!

Really excellent app. I use Duo, Lingvist, italki, coffee break spanish and read free spanish lang ebooks; this app really rounds out the bunch. Excellent grammar tips. Sort of like flash cards on crack. This app emphasizes thinking in the sense that you need to pause and decide how to say the phrase in the target language. The dev is clearly dedicated to this app and responds to feedback quickly.
replyContent: Thank you, glad to help!

content: Finally a close to perfect language app. Literally the first app I payed money for without hesitation . Recommend!
Absolutely great, so much content. I've tried a billion language apps and this is no doubt the very best üëçüëçüëçüëç
replyContent: Thank you! Don't forget you can send me emails from within the app if there are problems or you have suggestions.

content: Very good for rearning spain

Was on sale. I already had both German and French version. I decided to not let this one pass even if I don't intend to learn Spanish soon. I know that this app is really good like the French and German ones. Here's to hoping that you could make more of this app for other languages.
just the best way to learn language!!!

Excellent app, played with demo for a few days, then the full version sale popped up. I didn't hesitate. Organized well, explained new concepts, great easy interface. Not sure why the testing portion still tests on sentences that a have gotten 100% on Highly recommended!
replyContent: Each sentence has a memory score that goes up if you say you know it. Even if a sentence has a high score, it will pop up if lower score sentences were all tested today (after you test them, they are temporarily marked as very high score for this session) and there is nothing left to be tested than high score sentences.

content: your app is great, i hope you'll add Chinese soon
replyContent: Thank you  very much! I can't add Chinese because I don't know Chinese. I only teach the languages that I actually know, otherwise it don't know what is the easiest way to teach and I will end up making another generic app, like so many out there, with categories for sports and fruits :)

content: Brilliant idea, really helps me learn!
replyContent: Glad to hear that, thanks for the review!

content: I want to speak and understand Spanish. I have another app that grew frustrating because it is solely vocabulary. While that is invaluable, lists of discreet words don't make a language. It's like you have tomatoes and cheese and garlic in front of you, but they must all work together with the dough to make a pizza. It's tremendous to read complete sentences and the Spanish pronunciation is very good. A brilliant feature is the ability to switch between English to Spanish and Spanish to English.
replyContent: Yes,  words without context do not constitute a language. Thanks for the review!

content: Excellent application ! After about two weeks using demo I went to full paid version and it is working great. Easy, straightforward settings, no adds, works offline, just perfect. I would highly recommend it. Great job and many thanks.
replyContent: High praise! Thanks for the review. You can send me an email if you have any questions or problems with the app.

content: Love this app really teaches you Spanish in a practical way,me gusta mucho este app! Es el mejor que nunca yo he intentado!
lesson 369 says "the child" but translates " los ninos" doesnt that mean " the children"?
replyContent: Yes, of course. Sorry for answering so late, your review didn't show up in my email. I probably changed the sentence in Spanish to use the plural and I forgot to change the English translation.  I will change that this week. Thanks for using the app.

content: simple, descriptive and valuable

content: Very useful and well explained
replyContent: Thank you for your review.

content:
I like this app a lot and would recommend it; however it does sometimes use 
Spanish words more likely to be used in Latin America and seldom heard in 
Spain. This really only affects you if you are learning Spanish solely to 
use in Spain.

Very well thought out. I'd ideally want a list of sentences in the 
settings, that marks which sentences you got right, wrong, and in between 
on the test ... which would make it easier to scan through and also to see 
which you've most recently tested. Other than that ... great!
Unique mix of practice and explanation. Am enjoying it so far!

The tenses are not always accurate. Especially past tense (pret√©rito). "I 
stayed" in English is translated to "he quedado" ( I have stayed). It 
happens in many occasions. I have used many apps like Duolingo and they 
translate correctly.

Contains grammar explanations, not just a Vocabulary regurgitating app like 
what most others offer.
replyContent: Thank you very much! The goal of the apps is to actually teach you if you use them 30 minutes a day. They are not just to look good. That's why they don't look that good:)

content: I genuinely love this Spanish app. It's the only one I have purchased the full version of, and I consider it money WELL spent. I hope to become bilingual to interact with the Hispanic community and make them feel more appreciated in America, considering our current political climate. If it improves my marketable skillset, that's a bonus
replyContent: Thanks very much. Write me on my email if you have suggestions for improvements.

content: Best app of it's kind, by far! Easy to use, easy to understand and navigate - so pleased that I gladly purchased premium version. Thank you!
So far so good. Other apps just teach you the words with no explanation as to why it's this and not that. It's good to know Grammer.
I'm learning!!
Easy to get the hang of!
I ' m enjoying every moment of learning Spanish in this app. I love the way it starts very simple, and builds on the knowledge you've learnt. Excellent!
replyContent: Thanks, that's the idea, continuously consolidating what you know while adding a little with every new sentence.

content: Wonderful app
